parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions "Dumitru Rujan" as a candidate, implicitly referring to himself as a candidate for the parliamentary elections.  The image shows him in what appears to be a factory setting, possibly interacting with workers. This could be interpreted as an attempt to connect with a specific demographic (workers).</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The phrasing "stimate antreprenor sau viitor antreprenor" (dear entrepreneur or future entrepreneur) and "Pe 1 Decembrie, ieși la vot!" (On December 1st, go vote!) directly addresses a broad segment of the population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The core message of the post is to encourage voters to support Dumitru Rujan in the upcoming elections.  Phrases like "alege-ne să luptăm cu adevărat pentru tine" (choose us to truly fight for you) and the promises of support for entrepreneurs strongly suggest an electoral objective. The call to action "Pe 1 Decembrie, ieși la vot!" (On December 1st, go vote!) directly aims to influence voting behavior.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post mentions some general economic policies, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content.  It's primarily promotional, focusing on the candidate's promises and achievements, rather than providing balanced information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted political message aimed at swaying voters. The promises made and the call to action are not expressions of personal belief but rather campaign pledges.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1235337024405561</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Dumitru Rujan, fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It directly refers to a candidate (Dumitru Rujan), is used during the electoral campaign period (as evidenced by the "Pe 1 Decembrie, ieși la vot!" call to action), has a clear electoral objective (to garner votes for Dumitru Rujan), and targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement. The content goes beyond simple journalistic reporting by focusing on promises and achievements to promote the candidate.  The image accompanying the post further reinforces this by showing the candidate in a relatable setting, likely aiming to connect with a specific voter demographic.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Dumitru Rujan</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Dumitru Rujan, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 1235337024405561, care promovează candidatura sa la alegerile parlamentare prin afirmații precum "alege-ne să luptăm cu adevărat pentru tine" și promisiuni de sprijin pentru antreprenori, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea sa.  Postarea îndeplinește toate criteriile propagandei electorale, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, depășind limitele jurnalismului prin promovarea directă a candidaturii sale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
